Utils

dasftoolbox.utils.make_symmetric(matrix: ndarray) → ndarray[source]

Makes a matrix symmetric by averaging it with its transpose.

Parameters:

matrix (np.ndarray) – The matrix to make symmetric.

Returns:

The symmetric matrix.

Return type:

np.ndarray

dasftoolbox.utils.autocorrelation_matrix(data: ndarray, normalizer: int | None = None) → ndarray[source]

Computes the autocorrelation matrix of the data.

Parameters:

  • data (np.ndarray) – The data to compute the autocorrelation matrix for.

  • normalizer (int | None) – The integer to divide for normalization. If None, it is set to the number of columns (i.e., samples) of data.

Returns:

The autocorrelation matrix.

Return type:

np.ndarray

dasftoolbox.utils.cross_correlation_matrix(data1: ndarray, data2: ndarray, normalizer: int | None = None) → ndarray[source]

Computes the cross-correlation matrix of the data.

Parameters:

  • data1 (np.ndarray) – The first data to compute the cross-correlation matrix for.

  • data2 (np.ndarray) – The second data to compute the cross-correlation matrix for.

  • normalizer (int | None) – The integer to divide for normalization. If None, it is set to the number of columns (i.e., samples) of data1.

Returns:

The cross-correlation matrix.

Return type:

np.ndarray

dasftoolbox.utils.covariance_matrix(data: ndarray, normalizer: int | None = None) → ndarray[source]

Computes the covariance matrix of the data.

Parameters:

  • data (np.ndarray) – The data to compute the covariance matrix for.

  • normalizer (int | None) – The integer to divide for normalization. If None, it is set to the number of columns (i.e., samples) of data.

Returns:

The covariance matrix.

Return type:

np.ndarray

dasftoolbox.utils.cross_covariance_matrix(data1: ndarray, data2: ndarray, normalizer: int | None = None) → ndarray[source]

Computes the cross-covariance matrix of the data.

Parameters:

  • data1 (np.ndarray) – The first data to compute the cross-covariance matrix for.

  • data2 (np.ndarray) – The second data to compute the cross-covariance matrix for.

  • normalizer (int | None) – The integer to divide for normalization. If None, it is set to the number of columns (i.e., samples) of data1.

Returns:

The cross-covariance matrix.

Return type:

np.ndarray

dasftoolbox.utils.normalize(data: ndarray, scale: float = 1) → ndarray[source]

Normalize the data to be zero-mean and of specified variance.

Parameters:

  • data (np.ndarray) – The data to normalize.

  • scale (float) – The scale to normalize the data to. Default is 1.

Returns:

The normalized data.

Return type:

np.ndarray

dasftoolbox.utils.is_method_overridden(instance: Any, base_class: Type, method_name: str) → bool[source]

Check whether a method has been overridden in an instance compared to a base class.

Parameters:

  • instance (Any) – The instance to check for the overridden method.

  • base_class (Type) – The base class to compare the method against.

  • method_name (str) – Name of the method to check.

Returns:

True if the method has been overridden in the instance, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool
